title: ODI Futures: Show me the future of data in retail

details.description:
The UK is a world leader in innovating with data for retail. By using data better, retailers can provide quality information to consumers about their goods; target consumers with special offers or remind them what they’ve forgotten to buy; modify where products are placed within stores and shelves; and plan where to put new stores.

Image: Shopping Bag at Kendra Scott by Nan Palmero (CC BY-NC 2.0)

The Open Data Institute (ODI) and dunnhumby are bringing together people from across the retail sector for an ODI Futures event exploring data-driven innovation, with a focus on open data and open innovation.

We’ll hear from innovators across the sector, discuss the positive impacts that data-driven initiatives can bring to retail, and explore the ethical dimensions of the use of personal data by retailers.

Topics for discussion will include:

  • insights gained in retail through data: what works, what doesn’t, and why the implications of the General Data Protection Regulations and the need to engender trust on the provision of consumer insight
  • new technologies and the opportunities that they offer to retailers, suppliers and consumers
  • the role of retail information in society as a whole, such as in generating national statistics

There will be plenty of time to network, with a drinks reception after the talks.

Agenda

  • Chair: Jeni Tennison, Technical Director, Open Data Institute

  • Speakers: Jason Nathan, Group Managing Director for Data, dunnhumby Heather Savory, Director General of Data Capability, Office of National Statistics

  • Panel on the ethics of using consumer data

  • Flash talk speakers on data innovation in retail

Join the discussion on Twitter using #ODIFutures and #OpenRetail.

ODI Futures events bring business, government and academia together to examine the potential for open data in different sectors. They intend to be thought-provoking and offer space for in-depth discussion. ODI Futures events are recorded and we publish slides and sound files for each session.
